com.colofabrix.mathparser.operators.special

Class Vector

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.colofabrix.mathparser.expression.ExpressionEntry
      • com.colofabrix.mathparser.expression.Operator
        • com.colofabrix.mathparser.expression.GroupingOperator
          • com.colofabrix.mathparser.operators.special.Vector
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Comparable<Operator>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    VectorClosing, VectorOpening, VectorPush

    public abstract class Vector
extends GroupingOperator
    Represent the basic type to implement the operators to work with Vectors

    A vector type will create a vector in memory named OUTPUT_NAME which will contain all the operands specified in the vector. The vector type will also refer all the included indexes to the preceding opreator.
    What's inside a vector will be minimized if possible, otherwise it will be kept as a CmplxExpression

    Author:
    Fabrizio Colonna

    • Method Detail

      • prepareOperands

        protected ExpressionEntry prepareOperands(CmplxExpression postfix,
                              java.util.Stack<Operator> opstack,
                              Operators operators,
                              Memory memory)
                                   throws ExpressionException
        Moves the operands and the operators between stacks

        The vector type uses an internal representation of a vector (a Stack stored in memory) which is different than the usual postfix/opstack stacks. This function will fetch the operands from postfix and the operators from opstack and it will put everything in the local stack.
        The method will fetch everything was put in the stack until a previous OpenVector or PushVector is found.

        Parameters:
        postfix - The full postfix stack, as it is build before the call to this method
        opstack - The full operator stack, as it is constructed befor the call to this method
        operators - A reference to the operators manager
        memory - A reference to the main math memory
        Returns:
        An ExpressionEntry found since the last OpeningVector or PushVector
        Throws:
        ExpressionException - If no parameters are given to the function
